entry.title: May i know why SAP has deferred the program custom field related UR's as part of 2025 Vsaas release
entry.content:
Dear community members,

May i know why SAP has deferred the program custom field related UR's as part of 2025 Vsaas release. below are the ones deferred from Master requirements document->trace matrix sheet

UR IDFR IDAuthor StatusTest Case IDNew / Change2025 Notes
UR.10.2025.2FR.9.2025.2CompleteDeferredNewThe system shall provide the administrator the ability to search for a Program Custom Field.
UR.10.2025.3FR.9.2025.3CompleteDeferredNewThe system shall provide the administrator the ability to add a Program Custom Field.
UR.10.2025.4FR.9.2025.4CompleteDeferredNewThe system shall provide the administrator the ability to delete a Program Custom Field.
UR.10.2025.5FR.9.2025.5CompleteDeferredNewThe system shall provide the administrator the ability to edit a Program Custom Field's attributes.
UR.10.2025.6FR.9.2025.6CompleteDeferredNewThe system shall provide the administrator the ability to view a Program Custom Field.

Regards,

Ashok

entry.title: Re: Understanding Reporting Type Configuration and Its Im...
entry.content:
If the reporting type is configured as "Exempt Tax Invoice," then both "Summary of Tax Invoices by Suppliers" and "VAT Base Amount and Tax Amount by Per-Business Unit (Business Place) Taxation" will not include these invoices. However, they will be included in the "Summary of Invoices by Suppliers."

On the other hand, if the reporting type is configured as "Tax Invoice" and the tax rate is 0, the invoices will be excluded from "VAT Base Amount and Tax Amount by Per-Business Unit (Business Place) Taxation." If the tax rate is not 0, they will be included in both reports.

3660108 - Understanding Reporting Type Configuration and Its Impact on South Korea VAT Reporting Entity - SAP for Me

entry.title: Hiding sensitive Price information in Sales Order display
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'll like to seek some help on this requirement from my user.

They are requesting to hide all the price information in the Sales Order for personnel that are able to display the Sales order but not authorise to view the pricing in the order.

The areas which i noticed that contains the pricing in the sales order are, at the Line item net value.

The Price elements in the main display of the Sales order.

And also in the item level price elements.

I've tried using the Manage restrictions options in the Maintain business partner App to control the access rights, and assign this role to a test User ID. Trying various combinations of the restrictions and values but the Test User is still able to see the pricing without fail.

I'll like to ask if there's some steps that I've missed out thus the restrictions does not work according?

I'll be glad to share more of my settings if necessary for troubleshooting .

Thank you for any guidance on this.

Best Regards

Danny

entry.title: Re: Query error when adding a variable [%0]
entry.content:
Hi Omar,

When using UNION and/or embedded queries and/or cross database tables, the sql parser does not (always) know how to parse the normal B1 query parameters.

In this case you can use the following syntax:

/* select * from JDT1 x */
DECLARE @DATEPARAMETER AS DATETIME
SET @DATEPARAMETER = /* x.RefDate */ [%0]

--your query here
--using @DATEPARAMETER
--where you would use [%0]

Regards,

Johan

entry.title: Re: Please tell me the best place to track updates on bus...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question!

This information is communicated in the What's New information.

On the SAP Help Portal, navigate to the information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD?version=2508.500 (information for the latest release 2508).

In the What's New section, open the What's New Viewer:

Filter for the version, type of change, and category;

You will see all authorization-related changes.

In addition, there’s a central spreadsheet listing all changes relating to identity and access management (IAM) that have been introduced since the previous release. These changes affect applications, business catalogs, business role templates, and restriction type assignments. You can find this spreadsheet attached to SAP note 3607858 

I hope this helps. If not, please don't hesitate to provide your feedback and tell us precisely what you require.

Thanks!

Kind regards,

Henrike

 

.

entry.title: SAP API ManagementのアクセスログをSAP Cloud Loggingで可視化する方法
entry.content:
背景：API Managementのログが見えない問題

SAP API Managementでは、APIの公開・キー制御・レート制限・トラフィック制御といった機能を提供していますが、呼び出しログ（APIのアクセス状況・Header・Bodyの内容など）は、Integration Suiteの標準画面からは確認できません。

  • Integration Flowのログは見られるが、API Proxyのログは対象外

  • サマリーの情報(特定の期間で何回APIが呼び出されたか)などは標準ダッシュボードで見れる

  • Auditログやトレースログが存在しないため、API KeyやJWTなどの認証問題のトラブル解析が難しい

  • アクセス元IP、User-Agent、Headerの中身などを確認できない

このような背景から、API呼び出しの可視性向上を目的にCloud Loggingへの転送が必要とされます。

下図のように、個別のAPIの実行ログは見られないのです。(開発中であればAPI Policyのデバッグをすればよいのですが)

 

解決策：Cloud Logging（Syslog Drain）への転送

SAP BTPのCloud Foundry環境では、Cloud Loggingインスタンスにログを集約することが可能です。
API Managementのアクセスログも、カスタムログ出力（AssignMessage + MessageLogging）＋ syslog drain構成によりCloud Loggingに転送できます。

この構成を取ることで：

  • APIアクセスログを時系列に保存

  • BTP Logging UIやOpenTelemetry連携で全文検索・ダッシュボード表示

  • 障害解析や不正アクセス監視にも利用可能

 

補足説明：Cloud Loggingへのログ転送の簡易確認

Cloud LoggingにはCloud Foundryのログを出力する以外に、PUTリクエストでメッセージを突っ込むことができます。
例としてPostmanから下記のJSONメッセージをCloud Loggingに突っ込んでみます。
リクエスト：PUT
リクエストURL：Cloud LoggingのService Keyの[ingest-endpoint]

下図のように、Cloud Loggingにメッセージが保存されていることがわかります。

ということは、API ManagementのAPI Policyで、Service Calloutを利用し、上記と同様にCloud Loggingへのログ転送を行えばログが見えない問題を解決できると考えます。


API Policyの設定一例

<!-- AssignMessageで構造化ログ -->
<AssignMessage ...>
    <Set>
        <Payload contentType="application/json">
            {
                "path": "{request.path}",
                "ip": "{request.header.X-Forwarded-For}",
                "timestamp": "{system.timestamp}",
                "userAgent": "{request.header.User-Agent}"
            }
        </Payload>
    </Set>
    <AssignTo type="request" createNew="false"/>
</AssignMessage>

まとめ

SAP API Managementは非常に便利なAPI公開基盤ですが、アクセスログの可視性には課題があります。
本記事で紹介したように、Cloud Loggingとの組み合わせにより可視性を補完することが可能です。

  • Integration Suite UIで見えないログもCloud Loggingで一元管理

  • API Policyからカスタムログ出力

  • Syslog DrainでCloud Loggingへ転送

運用・セキュリティ両面で非常に有用な構成ではないかと考えています。

we have two key figures -> KF1 disaggregates based on DISAGGKF1

                                                   KF2 disaggregates based on DISAGGKF2

all the KF's are at same planning level(WKPRODLOCCUST)

now using a copy operator, coping the values from KF1 to KF2 and the expectation is KF2 must disaggregate based on DISAGGKF2 instead its equally disaggregating from COPY operator functionality.

any thoughts to handle this requirement please?

Regards,

Divya

entry.title: Set the batch number to a fixed value for each material (identical to the material ID)
entry.content:
Component：MM-FIO-IM-SGM

APP: MIGO – Post Goods Movement (for Purchase Order)

Business Requirement: Set the batch number to a fixed value for each material (identical to the material ID).

Problem: The batch number is created correctly during the first posting. However, when a goods issue is posted for the same material a second time, the batch field is not filled automatically because the BADI cannot generate a batch number that already exists. We have to enter the desired batch value manually; only then can the goods movement be posted.

Requirement: How can we fill in automatically of this fixed batch value for every goods movement?

Attachment:

First posting:

 

Second posting (same material):

 

Output value has generated but cannot fill in:

 

BADI:  LOBM_AFTER_BATCH_NUMBER_INT

entry.title: Dynamic Table Qualifier/ scheme change in Business objects 4.2
entry.content:
We are using SAP business objects 4.2 version tool and at present the business objects are pointed to HIVE and we repointing to Databricks using JDBC Driver.

We are facing following problem when we are repointing to Databricks

1.The Databricks tables are created under different catalog and schema and we are able to remap the tables manually.So we are not facing any issues.The universe design is handled through IDT tool.

2.The Tables are created under catalog with name is not same in all the environment. For example(In Dev Environment, databricks has created with Catalog_dev and in Test environment, they created a catalog name with catalog_test and the same for PROD environment)

3.While we migrate each environment, we need to remap the catalog and refresh the tables locally and publish and it tedious process for us.

4.Do we have any solution for to update the catalog name dynamically during migration.

This could help us to solve the problem.

entry.title: Re: How to make storage location field READ-ONLY in CO11N...
entry.content: Hi Team, I hope you're doing well. While analyzing the BADI implementations related to Order Confirmation, I came across the following BADIs: BD_WORKORDER_CONFIRM and BD_WORKORDER_GOODSMOVT_BKF_GDR. I am trying to validate the storage location during order confirmation. The goal is to compare the storage location from the Order with the one used during Goods Movement Order Confirmation, and raise an error if there is a mismatch. However, I noticed that in BD_WORKORDER_CONFIRM, the Storage Location is not available as an importing parameter, which prevents me from performing the required comparison directly within this BADI. Kindly Help.

entry.title: Re: Posted to Stock field in Create Physical Inventory do...
entry.content:
Hello @MT1208 

Thank you for bringing this up. In SAP S/4HANA Public cloud, the "Posted to Stock" filter in Create Physical Inventory Documents can only be hidden if it was initially optional and subsequently made mandatory through Adapt UI. If the app enforces the filter as mandatory, it cannot be removed. The practical workaround is to utilise variants, allowing users to avoid seeing it prompted SAP Learning-Simplifying Physical Inventory

If optional and made mandatory by the key user: open Adapt UI → Filter Bar, turn Mandatory off, and Publish SAP Help Portal-Adapting the UI

If the app is mandatory: create a default filter option with the selected value Yes/N) and enable 'Apply Automatically' so the app opens with that setting without user input. If both options are needed, create two separate filters variants/tiles SAP Learning-Using Variant Management

Some Helpful SAP References

App Help: Create and Manage Physical Inventory Documents (Filters, Process)  SAP Help Portal

Adapt UI (Key User) – how to modify filter bar settings and publish SAP Help Portal

Set Variant Management as Default and Apply Automatically, SAP Learning: Using Variant Management

Spaces and Pages – for tile placement. Note: Hiding a tile does not alter authorisation. SAP Help Portal

SAP Learning Journey (Sourcing & Procurement) – in the context of physical inventory, SAP Learning

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: link multiple return documents to a single invoice
entry.content:
Hi,

this is the standard for SAP, you cannot change an already posted document if it creates any bookings in the system (financial or stock).

Is there any special reason why you want to link it later on, and not immediately when you are creating the Invoice? Because you can easily link multiple Returns by simply opening the Invoice and using "Copy From" functionality, where you can select multiple Return documents and pull all the details from them to the Invoice. 

BR,

Matija

entry.title: Bank Statement via SOAP API with Posted status, the system creates Payment Allocation tasks
entry.content:
Issue Summary
When uploading a Bank Statement via SOAP API with Posted status, the system creates Payment Allocation tasks instead of automatically allocating payments to supplier invoices. I want to achieve automatic payment allocation through the SOAP API without manual intervention.
Current Situation
What I've Done:

Created Supplier Invoices manually:

SIV-229
SIV-230


Uploaded Bank Statement via SOAP API:

Used BankStatementBundleMaintainRequest_sync operation
Set ReleaseBankStatement to true (Posted status)
Added External Reference in Memo Line (PaymentExplanationNote) to link with supplier invoices
Bank Statement ID: 61


Current Result:

Bank Statement uploaded successfully in Posted status
However, a Payment Allocation task is created: "Complete Payment Allocation of Bank Statement 38/1 - -1,500.00 USD"
Manual intervention required to complete payment allocation
Payment Allocation ID: 65

 

Desired Outcome
I want the SOAP API to automatically allocate payments to supplier invoices without creating Payment Allocation tasks that require manual completion.
Questions:

Is it possible to achieve automatic payment allocation via the Bank Statement SOAP API?
What are the correct XML structure and field mappings required to:

Reference supplier invoices correctly
Trigger automatic payment allocation
Avoid creating manual Payment Allocation tasks


Should I use specific fields like:

PaymentTransactionDestinatedInvoiceReference
PaymentTransactionInitiatorInvoiceReference
Specific BusinessProcessVariantTypeCode values
Different PaymentTransactionCategoryCode values


Are there any prerequisites or business configuration settings that need to be enabled for automatic payment allocation via SOAP API?

entry.title: Re: Can I extend a certain app? With Clean Core? How?
entry.content:
Hi again @Gowthami5 ,

When it comes to influence, ask yourself if you think this should exist in SAP standard, as it is something that would benefit not only your specific case for your company, but more broadly. If yes, feel free to raise it (and motivate it).

Having said that, raising influence does not guarantee that anything happens. For one, the ticket needs a lot of upvotes to be considered. Next, there are probably reasons why something has not (yet) been released, and it may remain unreleased. Creating a release contract is not something like pressing a button to make people happy. No, it's a stability and upgrade promise by SAP, and as such, must fulfill certain criteria and is governed by strict quality. We only release what we can release. 

Regards

entry.title: Re: Error with some views
entry.content:
Hi,

views you mention are SAP views, generated when Schema is created. If those do not exist (you can verify through HANA Studio), I suggest raising a ticket directly to SAP to have the database checked.

BR,

Matija

entry.title: SAP Open Source Webinar: Efficient Microservices Delivery with Project Konfidence
entry.content:
Curious about how to best support the delivery of microservice-based SaaS applications across the cloud-edge continuum? Join us on November 4th at 3:00 pm CET, 9 am EST, 7:30 pm IST for a virtual session in our open source series where we introduce Project Konfidence, a new open-source project aimed at transforming the delivery of microservice-based SaaS applications. Konfidence is designed to simplify and modernize the delivery of microservice-based SaaS applications, helping developers to focus on business logic rather than tool management.

We’ll dive into how Konfidence fits into the open Apeiro Reference Architecture (ApeiroRA), part of the Important Project of Common European Interest - Next Generation Cloud Infrastructures and Services (IPCEI-CIS). You'll learn how it streamlines software releases, reduces infrastructure complexity, and supports modern deployment strategies like ring deployments and feature toggle management, all while following CNCF best practices.

Learn more about Konfidence's features, its open source development journey. Discuss your questions with Sarah Müller, engineering manager and Konfidence project lead at SAP, and Timon Schüle, head of a software delivery framework at SAP.

Register:  SAP Sign Up | [PUBLIC] SAP Open Source Webinar: Efficient Microservices Delivery with Project Konfidence

entry.title: Re: Why is it not possible to use the RAP dynamic feature control for hiding fields?

If you implement the hidden with the annotation for each field, it doubles the number of the fields in the entity and the logic for the field attributes is split in two different places, one for mandatory, read-only and another for hidden.

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Cloud Public Data Migration Plan
entry.content:
Hello, 

As far as I know, there are ongoing discussions around updating the data migration (DM) approach strategy document on SAP Activate. From the Migration Cockpit perspective, our focus is on the tool capabilities. We do not provide a planning template or specific project planning recommendations, as these are typically covered by consulting teams using their own methodologies.

However, we can offer Testing recommendations (link), which are available on our Data Migration Landing Page (link), and data migration checklist (link).

For an overview of available migration objects, please refer to the Migration Object Documentation (link). This page allows you to configure the view to include information such as "Predecessor Object" (for staging tables) and "Scope Item."

Please note, that prerequisites for the Direct Transfer approach are outlined within each respective migration object's documentation, under the “Prerequisites” section.

SAP Activate also provides relevant content:

  • Prepare Phase: Self-Enable on SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit (link)
  • Explore Phase: Data Load Preparation (link)

As a suggestion, it might be helpful to provide feedback about the “DM approach strategy” directly to the SAP Activate team using the SAP Activate Feedback button. Your input on topics like the “Planning Data Migration” could be valuable for future improvements of SAP Activate.

best regards,

Elizaveta

entry.title: Re: Which restriction type controls access to remittance...
entry.content:
Hello @kezelda 

Thank you for your question.

The Payment Advice controls the access to remittance advices or payment advices in public cloud.

This restriction can also be further restricted by Company Code, Customer or Supplier.

Please refer to Authorization Concept for Business Users & Manage Payment Advices for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to add the Services Rendered Date fiel...
entry.content:
Hello @kezelda 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Journal Entry Analyzer, Custom Business Objects, Fields, and Logic & Custom Analytical Queries for more details

In summary, the Services Rendered Date is not included by default in the Journal Entry Analyser. However, there are two options you can consider:

  • First is to check through the Custom Fields and Logic and see if the field is available in the Account Document Line Item business context and enable it.
  • Second option is to use the custom analytical queries by creating a custom query as a data source. You can add the Service Rendered Date if exposed in that CDS view. Your custom query can thereafter be published as a Fiori app similar to Journal Entry Analyser.

If the filed is still not exposed after those steps, consider raising a request via customer influence portal.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Shape What’s Next with SAP Integration Suite at TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community! 🚀 SAP TechEd 2025 is almost here!
Get ready to explore how we’re shaping the future of integration. Learn how SAP Integration Suite delivers on end-to-end integration requirements, discover how we’re driving modernization for customers, and see how enterprise automation can unlock new opportunities for your business.

Don’t miss the chance to gain insights, connect with experts, and experience the innovations that will power the next generation of intelligent enterprises. Join us at SAP TechEd 2025—in Berlin or virtually!

🚨Save the date and register today:  November 4-6, 2025 SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual 

What is in SAP Integration Suite track?

SAP Integration Suite empowers developers to drive innovation with an integration platform as a service (iPaaS) on SAP Business Technology Platform, which unifies on-premises and cloud-based systems, applications, events, and data. Discover how AI-powered capabilities in SAP Integration Suite can help harmonize user experiences and improve developer productivity and operational excellence across complex and diverse IT landscapes.

Take a look at our overall SAP Integration Suite sessions 👇 

 

Strategy Talk Sessions:

Roadmap Sessions:

Hands-on Sessions:

IN163 | Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite

IN260 | Master integrations: Integration Advisor and Trading Partner Management

Deep Dive sessions:

IN200 | Empower your agents to be responsible

IN201 | Enterprise integration artifact development with AI-driven optimizations

IN300 | Accelerate connectivity for your applications

IN103 | Helping systems talk smarter with a flexible event-driven architecture

IN301 | Streamline the development and governance of your integration strategy

IN302 | Run integration scenarios in private landscapes with Edge Integration Cell

 

Visit our booths at Berlin:

🔍Don't miss out! Explore the TechEd 2025 session catalog and ensure your favorite SAP Integration Suite track sessions are on your list. We're excited to connect with you at the upcoming TechEd sessions. 

Don't know how to build your TechEd agenda? Learn more from this blog post: Put your thinking cap on! It’s time to make some tough choices… 

✨We can’t wait to see you there in Berlin!

entry.title: How to Create and Manage Blanket or Framework Purchase Orders in SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Every organisation faces situations where certain goods pr services are required on a recurring basis. Think of office supplies, annual service contracts, or even utility payments, the demand is frequent , but the exact quantity or schedule isn't always predictable. Managing these thoroughly standard purchase orders can quickly become an administrative burden, as each request requires a new document, approval cycle, and follow-up.

To address this, SAP provides the Blanket (Framework) Purchase Order functionality, a powerful tool that streamlines repetitive procurement by consolidating requirements into a single long[-term agreement with defined validity and value limits.

In short, a Blanket PO serves as an umbrella contract: one agreement, multiple call-offs, controlled spend, and minimal effort.

Why Blanket Purchase Order Matter?

  • 🚀 Efficiency: Eliminate repetitive paperwork for recurring needs.
  • 🎯 Flexibility: Draw down as needed within agreed limits and validity
  • 💰Spend Control: Enforce budget caps with clear traceability
  • ✅ Streamlined Approvals: Approve once, transact many times
  •  🤝 Stronger Vendor Relationships: Ensure continuity and trust through consolidated commitments.

Business Scenario

Let's consider a Manufacturing company that needs office supplies such as stationary, printer cartridges, and cleaning materials throughout the year.

Without Blanket PO:

  • Every time suppliers are required, the buyer has to raise a purchase requisition, convert it into a PO, and route it for approvals. This mean delays, repeated approvals, and additional effort.

With Blanket PO:

  • The buyer creates a single PO valid for 12 months, capped at Rs. 5,00,000/-. Departments can call off against this PO until either the value limit or validity date is reached.

Result: Faster processing, reduced paperwork, tighter cost control , and complete visibility of spend. 

Step-by-Step Process in SAP S/4 HANA

Step 1: Define Number Ranges for POs

Path: SPRO > Materials Management > Purchasing > Purchase Order > Define Number Ranges for POs

Step 2: Define Document Types

Path: SPRO > Materials Management > Purchasing > Purchase Order > Define Document Types for Purchase Orders

Step 3: Create Framework Purchase Order (Transaction: ME21N or Create PO- Advanced)

Enter Header Data (Org Elements, validity dates under Additional Data)

In Item Data

  • Item Category: B - Limits
  • Account Assignment:
    • "K - Cost Center" (If known) or
    • "U - Unknown" (If account assignment will be defined later during posting invoice)

In Item Details (Limits)

  • Define overall value limit and expected amount
  • Maintain G/L account and cost center

Save Purchase Order PO #650003

Step 4: Post Invoices (Transaction: MIRO)

Since item category B disables Goods Receipt, invoices are posted directly.

Enter PO number and and vendor invoice details

Add invoice amount details in account assignment

Enter the amount and navigate to simulate 

Save Invoice #5105600817

Step 5: Review the Invoice Document

FI postings and follow-on documents can be monitored

Note: If the maximum limit is reached, the system will notify the user, preventing further postings.

 

Conclusion

Blanket (Framework) purchase order are not just a technical feature, they're a procurement strategy. By reducing repetitive work, enabling better spend control, and ensuring smooth vendor collaboration, Blanket POs significantly improve operational efficiency in SAP S/4 Hana.

 

If you found this guide helpful, don’t miss my other SAP MM WM blogs covering real-world automation, configuration tips, and best practices for procurement, inventory management, and warehouse management.

Click to view other SAP MM WM Blogs - SAP Community

 

Regards,

Mannem Leelamohan

entry.title: Re: How to handle RV61Axx price condition rules these days?
entry.content:
Hi @patrick_weber11 

Thank you for your question.

Please refer to KBA 2885513, Custom Logic,

https://www.saptechsolutions.com/pdf/VOFMFormulaRoutines.pdf,

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/vofm-to-create-a-formula-routine/qaq-p/2259309 for more details.

To summarise, SAP offers a modern, clean-core compliant framework, which has made the classic way of enhancing pricing logic with RV61xx routines no longer possible. They are no longer allowed. Due to the clean-core approach:

  • You can use the functionality of the pricing custom formula which is implemented through the released BadIs such as condition value and requirement routines.
  • These are configured through CBS/SSCUI and implemented with the Custom Logic app and thereby ensure you avoid any system modification.
  • The same framework is also available in S4HANA 2023 FP1 on-premise. So, you can replace RV61Axx routines in your on-premise system and prepare for a cloud-read setup.

This ensures you remain consistent across public cloud and on-premise, while elimination modification in the system and keeping your pricing logic upgrade stable.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Multiple Table views in Fiori App via RAP not working
entry.content:
I tried to get Multiple Table Views via RAP, in an OData V4 Fiori App, but it is not working.

In the metadata annotation I added the following in bold: 

@ui: { headerInfo: { title:{ value: 'MissionNeedsNumber' }, typeName: 'Product List', typeNamePlural: 'Product Lists', description:{ value: 'MissionName' } },

presentationVariant: [{ sortOrder: [{ by: 'MissionNeedsNumber', direction: #DESC }], visualizations: [{type: #AS_LINEITEM}] } ],

selectionVariant: [ {

text: 'completed (2 Ranges)',

qualifier: 'Completed'

},

{

text: 'In Process',

qualifier: 'InProcess'

} ] }

@ui.createHidden: #(hide_create)

annotate view zc_mn_missionneeds with

 

Source: https://github.com/SAP-samples/fiori-elements-feature-showcase/blob/main/README.md#general-features

In the metadata xml in can see it is getting loaded when opening the App. See bold part.

 

</Annotation>
<Annotation Term="SAP__UI.SelectionVariant" Qualifier="InProcess">
<Record>
<PropertyValue Property="Text" String="In Process"/>
</Record>
</Annotation>
<Annotation Term="SAP__UI.SelectionVariant" Qualifier="Completed">
<Record>
<PropertyValue Property="Text" String="completed (2 Ranges)"/>
</Record>
</Annotation>
<Annotation Term="Communication.Contact">

 

 Still, there are no text tabs on the List screen.

 

What am I doing wrong? Of course I don't do an actual selection yet, but I at least expected the text tabs to be present on the App list screen.

entry.title: Re: How to retrieve data for Business Partner (Customer (...
entry.content:
Hello @yahaha 

The fields you highlighted are in Japan: Invoice Summary within the customer master. SAP’s help confirms their exact location. SAP Help Portal-Maintaining Invoice Summary Data for Customers

Simple steps to verify quickly

First option to retrieve: API_BUSINESS_PARTNER entity A_CustomerCompany for the Business Partner and company code. Check the API’s $metadata in your tenant to see if the Japan-specific attributes are exposed. Not all country fields are available in every tenant check SAP Business Accelerator Hub

If not exposed in the API, use the View Browser to locate a released CDS view that contains the Invoice Summary fields. If found, wrap it with Custom CDS Views and publish via a Custom Communication Scenario to expose it as OData for your integration.

Connectivity for API_BUSINESS_PARTNER utilises SAP_COM_0008. Ensure you create the communication arrangement prior to making the call service. SAP Help Portal-Create Communication Arrangement for Business Partner Replication

Hope it helps,otherwise feel free to let me know

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP CPI: Retrieve Iflow unique id(reg_id) via IFlow (workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages)
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

There is an internal (unofficial) API for SAP CPI artifacts. 

https://<your-host>.hana.ondemand.com/odata/1.0/workspace.svc/ContentEntities.ContentPackages('<your-package>')/Artifacts?&$format=json

In comparison to the official API, it for packages it will give you an internal ID of an Iflow (reg_id). 
In browser, once one is logged into CPI, entering the URL will respond with JSON data back. 
But how to execute that in an automated Iflow?
I already tried to create OAuth2 (Code) credentials, read the Token via script and authenticate via Header. It did not work. 
Any hint, example is more than welcome.

thank you & kind regards | Simon

Sessions

entry.title: From Backlogs to Breakthroughs: What ABAP AI Means for Project Delivery
entry.content:
Hello everyone ! I am Shruthi, a Project Manager of BTP ABAP AI, and I am just about to celebrate my first anniversary with my team. Looking back at this past year, I feel so grateful for the people I work with, the projects we have delivered, and the way we have grown together. 

One thing I have noticed time and again is how small changes—like a new validation rule, a UI tweak, or a simple workflow adjustment—can have a huge impact for business users. But these “small” requests often take longer than expected because they get caught in processes and development backlogs. 

That is why the recent blogs on ABAP AI and the Extensibility Assistant really resonate with me. They show how SAP is already delivering tools that make development faster and extensibility safer. 

Key Highlights You Should Explore 

Here are some excellent resources that set the stage for this journey: 

  •  @Simona Marincei’s Blog: ABAP AI Revolution: Accelerates the ABAP Developer Who Built Enterprise Apps 
  • @GeorgWilhelm’s Blog :  Extensibility Assistant for Key Users: The Extensibility Expert Right Next to You 
  • @AlexanderRother’s Blog:  ABAP AI Chapter 2 
  •  Joule for Developers – YouTube Playlist 

Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities – Free and Ready to Use 

One of the most exciting developments for us right now is Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities. It is available for free usage today and brings AI-powered assistance directly into the hands of developers. 

With Joule for Developers, you can: 

  • Generate and refactor ABAP code with AI guidance. 
  • Explore sample data and learning materials. 
  • Speed up everyday development tasks and reduce repetitive work. 
  • Access tutorials and demos from the YouTube playlist. 
  • For teams like mine, this is a real enabler—it means we are not just talking about AI as the future, we are using it today to accelerate delivery and learn new ways of working. 

What We Are Experiencing 

In my role, I see these tools helping in very practical ways: 

  • Business users get changes rolled out more quickly. 
  • Developers focus on high-value, complex scenarios. 
  • Projects move forward with smoother coordination. 

The result is a stronger partnership between IT and the business, and a better experience for everyone involved. 

Final Thought 

  • ABAP AI today is already making a difference—it accelerates development, empowers key users, and ensures safe extensibility with built-in governance. And with Joule for Developers ABAP AI Capabilities now free to use, every developer has the chance to explore AI-powered assistance directly. 
  • For me and my team, this means more delivered outcomes, happier stakeholders, and projects that stay on track. 

As I celebrate one year with this fantastic team, I look forward to what the next chapter will bring. The journey of ABAP AI is still unfolding, and I am excited to see where it takes us.  

 I would love to hear your thoughts: how are you using ABAP AI in your projects, and what impact has it had so far?

entry.title: Re: Traceability Log validity details
entry.content: Dear Customer, If you want to keep each traceability log, you can create an new functionality. Do one of the following: Choose Run With Traceability Log. Choose Run With Traceability Log Saved to [your remote folder location] if you have defined a remote folder location to store and read your traceability log file from. For more information, see Configure Destination for Remotely Stored CSV Files and Create a Mapping Job. Configure Destinations for Remotely Stored Folders or CSV Files https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_Group_Reporting_Data_Collection/e29950571a2b4065b1dacaf881c67413/9e69b6c7b0ca4f488caccc083957f25f.html?version=1.0

entry.title: SAP Customer Checkout Price Update Issue
entry.content:
SAP Customer Checkout is connected with CCO Manager, and all item master data is being synced from CCO Manager.

On certain POS systems, the price for some items is not updating correctly, and the issue appears randomly across items. After checking the SAP Customer Checkout database, I found that the updated price is reflected in the Price Discount entity. However, in cases where the price is not updating, both the old and the new prices are present in the Price Discount entity, and for some reason, CCO is still picking up the old price instead of the new one. Additionally, both entries have the same timestamp.

Since the client is currently live, this is causing significant disruptions in their operations. CCO Version 2.0 FP20 PL03

But once the CR is activated,i can see the Postable to all company codes is set to 'X'.

Any suggestion through which this can be achieved is highly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: Hiding sensitive Price information in Sales Order dis...
entry.content:
Hi @danny_loo 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend exploring KBA 2963264, Role-Based Access to Price Elements, Pricing & Adapting the UI for guidance.

In summary, using Access Restriction for Access to Price Elements is the right approach. However, in public cloud, the restriction framework controls mainly the Price Elements tab. If it was correctly configured, user will no longer be able to open or drill into condition records. However, summary fields like Net Value and Gross Value will remain visible. This cannot be hidden without authorisation objects.

  • For you to fully meet your requirement, you will need to combine two approaches:
  • First you will have to restrict price elements through IAM by setting the Access Price Elements to No Access.
  • Thereafter, you need to hide the net value/gross value through the UI function in the Sales Order app to removed net value field or item list and pricing header. Then publish the variant and assign it to the restricted role.

This way, any user can still open and track orders but they will not see pricing details anywhere.

I hope this provides the desired insight.

Best regards

Chris
